subject: News Summary
body:
CBSNews.com






June 12, 2007

TOP STORIESBush Presses GOP On Immigration
With his immigration reform plan stalled in Congress, President Bush made a rare personal appearance on Capitol Hill hoping
                        to sway Senate Republicans to back the bill. Mr. Bush said the status quo "is unacceptable." More...Watch: Bush On Immigration Bill
• Hamas Captures Key Palestinian Facility
                     					| Watch• U.S.: Iran Transferring Weapons To Taliban• House Panel Probes "Poisoned Patriots"U.S.5 Kids Die In Pittsburgh House Fire
Fire swept through a three-story home in Pittsburgh, killing five young children, ages 2 to 7, who were believed to have been
                        under a babysitter's care at the time. Two other children were taken to hospitals. Police are looking for the babysitter. More...Watch: 5 Kids Dead in Pittsburgh Fire
• Ga. Teen Still Jailed, Despite Court Order
                     					| Watch• The Cruel Fate For A Boy Named Osama
                     					| Watch• Duke Lacrosse DA Ethics Trial Begins• More StoriesWorldHamas Captures Key Palestinian Facility
Hamas now occupies the headquarters of the Fatah-allied security forces. Meanwhile, Mahmoud Abbas' Fatah movement is considering
                        pulling out of the government coalition with Hamas as the factional fighting in Gaza intensifies. More...Watch: Gaza Nears Civil War
• U.S.: Iran Transferring Weapons To Taliban• Drug Wars Endanger Mexican Press• U.S. Kills 7 Afghan Cops In Friendly Fire• More StoriesPoliticsFBI Chief Flying High In Anti-Terror Jet
The Washington Post says FBI chief Robert Mueller routinely flies a $40 million jet intended for crucial anti-terror work
                        to speeches and appearances. And Giuliani hangs on as Thompson surges. Joel Roberts has the best of the day's headlines. More...
• Clinton Gets Campaign Link To Latinos
                     					| Watch• White House: No Watch-Gate
                     					| Watch• Bush Presses GOP On Immigration
                     					| Watch• More StoriesHealthFDA Keeps Eye On Body Parts Companies
Federal regulators say they have dramatically boosted inspections of companies that harvest cadaver body parts for transplant,
                        acknowledging weaknesses in government oversight of the multibillion-dollar human tissue industry. More...
• China  Plays Down Food Safety Problems• Getting Pumped May Aid Heart Patients
                     					| Watch• Sun Safety Vital At A Young Age
                     					| Watch• More StoriesSciTechHouse Panel Probes "Poisoned Patriots"
Federal health investigators say Marine families who lived at Camp Lejeune in North Carolina over three decades drank water
                        contaminated with toxins as much as 40 times over today's safety standard. More...
• Deaf Dolphin Gives Birth In Florida
                     					| Watch• Atlantis Mission Extended For 2 Days
                     					| Watch• Auto Industry Plays The Safety Card
                     					| Watch• More StoriesBusinessAuto Industry Plays The Safety Card
In radio ads and over the Internet, the auto industry is pushing a message that implies that tougher standards will force
                        automakers to make smaller and lighter cars that are not as crashworthy as today's less-efficient models.  More...Watch: The Benefits Of Going Small 
• Four Inexpensive, Easy Home Improvements• Many Baby Boomers Plan To Retire Late• Aviation Expert Blasts FAA
                     					| Watch• More StoriesEntertainmentAbout 12 Million Watched "Sopranos" Finale
An estimated 11.9 million people watched Sunday's finale of HBO's "The Sopranos" - and every one of them seemed to have an
                        opinion about the series' open-ended conclusion. More...
• Paris And Lindsay: Is The Party Over?
                     					| Watch• Soap Stars Glam Up For Daytime Emmys
                     					| Watch• Kelly Clarkson: Love Doesn't Come Easily• More StoriesOpinionGarbage In, Garbage Out
CBSNews.com legal analyst Andrew Cohen observes a lack of uniformity in how the Bush administration treats terror suspects,
                        which results in the courts throwing out cases and reversing Justice Department decisions. More...
• Baghdad Security Plan A Success
                     					| Watch• A Hidden Assault On Liberties
                     					| Watch• Rudy's Unconventional Bid
                     					| Watch• More StoriesCBS NEWS BROADCASTSThe Early Show: A Handy Guide To Relationships
Cosmopolitan magazine editor in chief Kate White chats with Hannah Storm about PDA's -- public displays of affection. More...Watch: Decoding P.D.A.

Gaza Nears Civil WarWith reports of gruesome street executions and savage brutality, fighting between Palestinian rivals Hamas and Fatah is seemingly
                                    at the brink of civil war. Charlie D'Agata reports.
